description: This is a traditional practice used by farmers to protect stored grains from pests without using chemical pesticides. Neem leaves are added to grain sacks or storage containers to repel insects. This method is low cost, eco-friendly and safe for health.
steps: Wash the matka with clean water and salt to remove smell.
Fill with drinking water and keep it in a shaded airy place.
Cover the mouth with a clean cloth or lid.
Draw Neem leaves in sunlight before use.
Put a layer of Neem leaves in grain sacks or storage containers.
Replace Neem leaves every two weeks as needed.
risks: Improper cleaning may lead to contamination.
Failure to replace Neem leaves may reduce effectiveness.
